Package eu.advance.logistics.flow.engine.block.db

Class Summary
JDBCConverter Utility class to convert to and from SQL and XML representation of values in JDBC queries.
JDBCDelete Delete entries from the given datastore by using the query and parameters.
JDBCDeleteAll Delete a batch of entries from the given datastore by using the query and parameters.
JDBCInsert Inserts a new value into the datastore via the given SQL statement and fills in the parameters from the supplied map.
JDBCInsertAll Inserts a collection of values into the datastore via the given SQL statement and fills in the parameters from the supplied map.
JDBCQuery Issues an SQL query into the datasource once a trigger object arrives and returns the rows converted into a mapping from column name to column value.
JDBCQueryAll Issues an SQL query into the datasource once a trigger object arrives and returns the resulting rows all at once mapping from column name to column value.
JDBCQueryOption Issues an SQL query into the datasource once a trigger object arrives and returns the rows converted into a mapping from column name to column value.
JDBCReplace The combined operation of insert and update operations, e.g., tries to insert a new entry into the datastore or update an existing one.
JDBCReplaceAll The combined operation of insert and update operations, e.g., tries to insert a batch of new entries into the datastore or update an existing ones.
JDBCThrottledBatchQuery Queries and returns a batch of rows from the database and waits for a trigger to continue.
JDBCThrottledQuery Query a batch of results from the datasource and return them one-by-one.
JDBCUpdate Issues the given update SQL query into the datasource and fills in the query parameters from the supplied mapping from column name to column value.
JDBCUpdateAll Updates multiple values at the same time with the given SQL query on the datasource and emits an update count once the batch update completes.
